channel.title: The Suffering sound problem
channel.description:
The Suffering was recently released as free. I figured I'd download it and give it a try.
However, I have this annoying problem with the sound. Randomly, certain sounds, usually gunfire and dialog, totally drops out. I have no idea why this would happen. I tried disabling onboard sound, but I got no sound at all afterwards.
Anyone have the slightest clue what's going on?

item.title: The Suffering sound problem
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

It’s free now? I got the demo in a magazine a few years ago and as I recall it was genuinely boring, where is it available?

How the fuck were you board, I’m terrified with the random screamer pop-ups and shit.

Read full topic

I’ve done that already and it got rid of the more pressing sound problem, but the sound still drops out at points.

Read full topic

item.title: The Suffering sound problem
item.dc:creator: Garcian_Smith
item.description:
From another board:

I think I’ve got a solution for ya. Open Run(start>all programs>accessories>run) type in RegEdit hit OK. In there hit HK_LOCAL_MACHINE. Then SOFTWARE. Scroll down and click Surreal, then Riot Engine. Delete SettingsDX105. Once you do that, run The Suffering again and the box that pops up when you first run it that asks you to config will come up. Reconfig your video however you had it. Then under the audio tab, uncheck the box next to Use 3D Sound Buffers. That’s what worked for me.

If that doesn’t work you can do it again and try configging it in other ways. Hope this helped.

Read full topic

item.title: The Suffering sound problem

item.description:
I have no clue, but posting in the Help and Support section may help. Just a hint.

Read full topic
